chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Violation report from RCAP.

Defendant Richard L McManus in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Plea:
15CF235:  Cts. 1&2 w/o RO enhancers - G.
BTC:
15CF235:  Cts. 1&2 - GUILTY.
15CF1717:  DRI.
PSI ordered.
.
for modification of bail, filed by Atty Hamad.
ZCI

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  No contact with the victim, SAG (person, property, residence or family).   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 2/1/2016  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances - bond condition(s) to be monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc., located at 524 S Main Street in Racine (262-632-1780).  You are to report to their office immediately following your hearing.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.

**AMENDED 3/8/2016 No violent contact with the victim S.A.G. but may not reside in the same residence.**
Plea hearing on March 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Richard L McManus in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- Offer has been extended, request a COP date.
Def- Request the bond be modified to request no violent contact with the victim.
St- Will leave it up to the court.
BTC: Bond modification granted to no violent contact with the victim.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
ZCI

from victim re: case (copies forwarded to ADA Rich and Atty Hamad)
Status conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Richard L McManus in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Richard L McManus in custody.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Request the bond be modified to no violent contact with the victim and request the amount be amended to $500.00 cash.
St- Objects to the bond modification.
BTC: Bond modification granted. $1,000 signature bond, no contact with S.A.G, her residence or her children and may not consume or possess any drugs or alcohol with ZCI to monitor.
